docreader.list

Class ListReaderPlain.PlaceholderReplacer

  • java.lang.Object
    • docreader.list.ListReaderPlain.PlaceholderReplacer
  • Enclosing class:
    ListReaderPlain

    private static final class ListReaderPlain.PlaceholderReplacer
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the character replacement and formatting for a single xsLevelNumber

        Add a new replacement for a given position
        Parameters:
        position - Offset in the placeholderString where to add the replacement
        levelTuple - Source data for the replacement
        isLegalNumbering - LegalNumbering qualifier from the level for which the replacement string is computed

      • putReplacement

                           java.lang.String replacement)
        Add a new replacement for a given position
        Parameters:
        position - Offset in the placeholderString where to add the replacement
        replacement - Raw string containing the replacement characters; Note: This string may have an arbitrary length

      • getReplacedString

        public java.lang.String getReplacedString()

        Returns:
        replaced string; never null

      • formatPlaceholder

        private static java.lang.String formatPlaceholder(ListReaderPlain.LevelTupleReadOnly levelTuple,
                                                  boolean isLegalNumbering)
        Formats a single level (thus a single replacement char in the placeholderString)
        Parameters:
        levelTuple - data of the current level (whose iLvl may be >= than that of the target level)
        isLegalNumbering - LegalNumbering qualifier of the target level (i.e. the level where the formatting shall eventually be applied for)
        Returns:
        a formatted representation of the number in the given levelTuple; never null

      • intToRoman

        private static java.lang.String intToRoman(int input)
        Convert the arabic number representation of a list item to its roman version

        based on Finding out list numbers in Word document using POI HWPF

        Parameters:
        input - The number to be converted
        Returns:
        A string with the roman representation of the input; never null

      • intToLetter

        private static java.lang.String intToLetter(int input)
        Convert the arabic number representation of a list item to a letter-based one

        Word uses this sequence: a..z, aa..zz, aaa..
        Hence we can wrap around with modulo and avoid a loop.

        based on Finding out list numbers in Word document using POI HWPF

        Parameters:
        input - The number to be converted to a letter
        Returns:
        A string containing the letter representation of the input

      • intToOrdinal

        private static java.lang.String intToOrdinal(int input)
        Convert the arabic number representation of a list item to a ordinal one
        Parameters:
        input - THe number to be converted to ordinal
        Returns:
        A string containing the original number with English ordinal suffixes
